Reviews.Title: “Location is good for the day but terrible at night”
Reviews.Author: Bri416231
Reviews.Content: Good location for the day but terrible at night due to a club at the Plaza when it closes at 4am, you will be up with the chatting, screaming etc. If you sleep like a rock you are okay. It is far from being a 4 star hotel. The breakfast area is in the basement and can fit only around 20 people. Hot, tight and not worth the breakfast. The price is also not worth for what you get. You can do better in similar places for less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: alexdelange
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we need room for four people. It is a small, pretty simple, modern, clean, nice service, good location hotel in the center of Madrid. Two blocks from Puerta del Sol. Nice coffee machine in the lobby. Tripadvisor rates it 4 stars. It is more like a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Geat location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: benjaminModiinIsrael
Reviews.Content: We had been twice in this nice hotel. The last time it was on March 2012. We came again because we enjoy our stay a couple years ago. This time we got a back room on the 4th floor were the only window was in front of the exhaust of the downstairs restaurant. It was impossible to open the window till 1am. The room was stuffy and the air condition system was working on winter mode only. The only good thing we can say about our stay was the great location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the service great - the platter of fruit waiting in our room was a much appreciated bonus. Bed was very comfortable and large. Room had an exercycle (which we didn't use). Bathroom was sapcious. Unfortunately it was very noisy outside and so needed to keep the double-glaxed doors shut but it was a bit hot and stuffy. The hotel is in a very good location - central and handy to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to be home now”
Reviews.Author: Caitlin C
Reviews.Content: I booked this boutique hotel after researching and using the reviews from the blog, delicious baby, regarding hotel with children. The bunk room was ideal for four. However plaza de carmen is littered with party people all night long and the noise escalates at six am when the discotheque empty out into the square. The beds don't have duvets just one sheet. Bathroom is good. Breakfast is super simple and in the basement. It was family style backpackers. We wanted a plush weekend trip and a good bed. Beds are horrible. Hotel is decent but nothing special at all and I left feeling dirty. Next time , the Westin hotel for the bed and pillows! Madrid is laid out perfectly for walking everywhere. It's really easy to be near prado and walk to royal palace or mercado San Miguel. No need to worry so much about being close to center.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Shuism
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 10, staying for 3 nights in mid November. The hotel is located in a square and although tucked away, it takes less than a couple of minutes to reach Sol and from there you can pretty much do anything, and go anywhere! The staff were very helpful and friendly, and despite us being such a large group they did their best to accommodate us the best that they could. Free wi-fi was a welcome addition (you'll need to ask at the front desk for a code). The rooms were very clean and modern, and the decor for each room was very different to the next. The bathroom was clean and large, the shower had 3 settings, rain, hose and massage. I wasn't tall enough to utilise the massage option but the rain head was certainly very nice. The only problem with the rooms was ventiliation - we found it got very hot very quickly and there was no air conditioning unit in the room. Though a word of warning - as nice as the hotel was, it's located in a very lively and noisy part of town. The square seems to be a meeting ground for very merry folk who enjoy singing, shouting and hanging around, particularly very late in the evening up until the early hours of the morning (but not the dangerous types in case you're wondering!) This hotel is therefore suited to those who don't mind noise and enjoy the convenience of having bars, restaurants and clubs within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “No rooms for us when we arrived!”
Reviews.Author: eyvvv
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were told that they didn't have any rooms for us as several guests are sick and did not checkout. They claimed they didn't have our contact details (which is impossible) and therefore were unable to let us know. Instead they put us up at the High Tech President Castellana Hotel which was located way across town and a distance away from the main shopping, eating and sightseeing area. We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel doesn't have any restaurant. Had to go down to ask for hot water. Staff at the desk were quite helpful. We need to call a doctor and they managed to get a doctor to come past midnight. The rooms were weird. The double room toilet was all glass and no privacy at all. Water leaked from the bath tub. The twin room toilet had some kind of screen pasted on the glass but was still see through. Overall, it was not a very comfortable stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Madrid99187069
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. Pros Fantastic location – very central, Great number of restaurant / bars within walking distance. Friendly Staff, Room modern with a good power shower and very clean. Cons Very, very noisy – drunks in the square until very early morning (up to 5.00am) singing, shouting that seems to echo. Air Con not great. Breakfast – very small dining room and not enough tables resulting in long delays at breakfast. Mini Bar expensive (but what you would expect!) I would return but maybe ask for a room at the back away from the noise. Location Location Location was great...

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Modern room”
Reviews.Author: andrit2010
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location, located behind the busy street of Gran via....there are many petit palace around the areas..so make sure you look for the right one. 5 min from Gran via metro or Sol.. walk distance to palace and museum. booked deluxe room thru splendia, when arrived welcomed with a bottle of wine and basket of fruit, great High tech shower system, very clean room, modern, has a laptop in the room, study desk, safety box, wi fi avaiable for the entire place del carmen block and can ask for muiltiple password- valid for until the end of your stay. Receiption 24/7. breakfast is simple but reasonable and nice..83.5 euro wont go wrong. there are convinince stop just around the corner. staffs are helpful. I will definately stay there again when i come back to madrid next year.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE LOCATION,”
Reviews.Author: Steve1oo
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was to small for three people, we had to walk around the room in a permenant stoop because of the sloping ceiling, it was not good, the room was so hot and there is no Air Conditioning in the hotel. The Power Shower with all it's mod con's was hopeless, ther was only one setting that really worked so it was adequate at the most.. The use of the lap top was a waste of time there was no mouse and therefore was unusable. The hotel was decorated and furnished to a good standard and teh staff were extremely helpful and polite. The location was excellent in terms of accessing the main sights, however the square has become the meeting place for political activists and debates that go on every night, all night into the early hours, it is impossible to sleep with the noise they create with their megaphones and cheering, Understand these protesters do not have quite debates they become very heated and loud. Although the location was good I would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable room temperature - poor night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel808
Reviews.Content: The positives: - The room we stayed in was modern, nice and clean, and matched the photos shown on the website. It was small but I have come to expect this from European hotel rooms of this class. - The location was quite central to the major sights, a 5 min walk to Puerta del Sol. - The hotel staff was generally helpful when we had questions. The negatives: - The room temperature was extremely warm which made it very uncomfortable. We had to open the windows and our door in order to cool the room down to an acceptable temperature. The hotel does not have air conditioning available this time of year (April) so if you turn the fan on using the thermostat in the room, it actually turns the heater on. Would be nice if the hotel had a note explaining this next to the thermostat so guests don’t do this and end up learning the hard way. - It was very noisy at night until the early morning in the Plaza del Carmen which the hotel faces. Because it was so warm in our room, we had to leave the window open and there were people loitering and making a lot of noise outside our window from late at night until around 8 in the morning which made it difficult to sleep. - While a laptop was provided in the room, which was a nice touch, the mouse cover was missing (it was also missing from the laptop in the room my parents stayed in) so it made it extremely difficult to navigate the cursor with it and made the laptop essentially unusable. In summary, I wouldn’t choose to stay here again, mainly due to the uncomfortable hotel room temperature. Between that and the large amount of noise generated from the people loitering in Plaza del Carmen, it made it nearly impossible to get a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location, cozy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cherrysameer
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. within 3 min walk are the 2 major metro stations-Gran via and Sol. Hotel is clean and cozy. The receptionists wer very helping. They went a little out of the way to help us. We had a family room.some Beware, some rooms are more spacious than others even though they are for same price.The attic room was cozy and should be perfect for romantic getaways. Free internet was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent address - Nice and clean rooms - Good location”
Reviews.Author: 1st_kensington
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long week end with three friends there. After reviewing comments on tripadvisor I have decided to book a room at this hotel. We were extremely pleased by our hotel: good price/value, good location. Rooms are clean and pretty modern. Good quality of sleep..overall a good address for Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “I doubt there is a better location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: QueenKat_9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice on business and the location is excellent, both for business via the subway and for tapas and beer in the evening. Staff very polite, rooms excellent and free laptop and wifi a definite winner. Breakfast was very good also. I will use this hotel whenever I am in Madrid, superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Felix UK
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a great spot. Walkable distance to everything. Surrounded by metro stations. Restaurants in every direction. I think the square had recently been rennovated. It was delightful. Cafe at the bottom of the building always full of locals with families (day-time). Not open late. Lovely place for a glass of wine. At no time did we feel unsafe walking to-from hotel . Rooms weren't large - but very comfortable. Comparatively big and modern bathroom with great shower. Staff spoke excellent english and were very helpful at every stage. Was excellent value as part of an expedia flight/hotel deal. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A short trip to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: kenny02
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, quite trendy and modern but expensive for what you got. The staff were friendly and the hotel clean but the location of the hotel was pretty grim, especially at night. This, obviously was not shown in pictures of the hotel. Overall I enjoyed my stay there but I don't think I would go back. Saying that it was in a a central location so handy if you are going out to the clubs and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: Funtravel85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing - you cannot beat the location, it on a quiet square, and the staff was very friendly. However, the key to happiness here is to book one of the two rooms with a jacuzzi. These are on the 4th floor/attic which are spacious and a great value. All the other rooms have high tech modern showers which just do not work that well and make quite a mess. We had a standard room the first night and the jacuzzi room the next two nights and they are not comparable. If you go to Madrid and can reserve the jacuzzi rooms, I assure you that you will not find a better place for value, comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “Lights and shadows”
Reviews.Author: FSaragoca
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the same amount of good things (lights) and bad things (shadows). - Staff very friendly and pleasant but not truly professional; - Good location and noisy environment; - Not 4 stars but rates are adjusted; - Power shower but risky bathroom ( slipery); - Free laptop and internet in room. Nevertheless i would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Big let down!”
Reviews.Author: pejey
Reviews.Content: Despite the many warnings given by reviewers on this site, I foolishly went aheaand booked this hotel for a romantic get away. First things first the staff are definitely friendly and pleasant enough and the location is brilliant BUT I requested an attic room with a jacuzzi and was given a double room with two single beds pushed together! Breakfast was a nightmare because there is not much space so you might end up waiting for ages for a free space. Did I mention how small the room was ?? Certainly not good value for money,as for 4 star?? I definitely do not recommend this hotel for anything other then the location (if you dont mind the sex workers that line the streets just round the corner)and friendly personnel!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: gengriff
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in same hotel over 7 days as we went off travelling and returned. As mentioned rooms are very small, especially for us as a family. Foldable bunk beds are comfortable and matresses not as hard as the main beds (two pushed together) which were quite uncomfortable. First room (308) the best. Balacony onto square and room clean. Only downside is blind in bathroom falling down and it wasn't fixed during our stay. When we returned put in attic room. Not much walking height and both my husband and myself banged our heads. Bathroom gave no privacy at all, especially for a family as it had 2 frosted glass walls. Also only tiny attic window with a badly hung (or unhung) curtain lining. Noise from neighbouring room bad with the sound of their TV and children running around. Reception happy to move us to another room. Next room on first floor. Window/doors opened onto roof of ground floor with other windows and brick wall for a view. Had to look up 4 floors to see blue sky! Bathroom had cheap plastic shower curtain and impossible to get access to wardrobe. No mirror in main room so a fight for bathroom mirror. Again bathroom had frosted glass wall into main room. Wall paper peeling under patio doors with exposed rotten wood. Carpet badly stained. Free coffee in reception is via machine (not always open) in small plastic cups. Tv in rooms all Spanish channels (well you are in Spain) with only Sky news in English. Laptops in room a bit hit. Only one chair in room to sit in. Reception staff lovely and polite and happy to help with our faltering Spanish. Especially helpful to our daughter, who tried to have all her conversations in Spanish with the staff, telling her the right words to use etc. Location superb and we felt safe walking about as a family at night. Easy access to metro. Taxi to from Airport 35 and 31 euros (traffic heavier one way). Taxi to bus station 10 euros. Metro cheaper option if travelling light (2 euros per person). For the price we paid I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great tech hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uk-Traveller300
Reviews.Content: Excellent contemporary tech hotel(free laptop and internet in room) very clean and comfortable. Great location for city and sightseeeing ,free coffee and water machines in lobby. Staff very friendly and helpful. Only tiny minor was immediate location of hotel, tucked away in quiet corner was nice but all the local dossers thought so too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: twicesideways
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. As we read earlier, the location could not have been better. Just steps away from the heart of the city, and Plaza del Sol. There were plenty of places in the area that had English menus. The hotel itself was very nice. The staff was very very friendly and everyone that we dealt with spoke English. It was a very "high tech" hotel. The bathroom was huge and our room was a decent size. I've stayed in smaller in Canada. We had the double room, which was really just two single beds pushed together. The breakfast was included in our price, and the buffet was very nice. It did not change from day to day, but there was always something good to eat. Plenty of fresh fruit and pastries daily. All in all it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, but there are some issues”
Reviews.Author: MarcosSix
Reviews.Content: As almost always happens, the previous reviewers gave us a very real picture of what to expect at the Petit Palace Plaza del Carmen. The location is wonderful, hard to beat. You may go to almost every major attraction by foot. Besides, you will be among three major metro stations (Gran Via, Puerta del Sol and Callao) which makes it very easy to reach wherever you want to go. The hotel is an old building but it´s hard to tell that once you get in it. Very modern inside, friendly staff and filled with lots of nice complimentary stuff like the coffee machine at the lobby or the notebook in the room with free access to the internet. As a matter of fact I´m writing this very review on it. The bathroom is magnificent, huge, and the shower is astonishing. The breakfast is also very good. Now, let´s get to the issues. The first obvious one is about the size of the room, very, very small indeed. It´s hard to store your clothes, to move around, to open the minibar, etc. But the worse thing is that they don´t turn on the air conditioning untill is summer outside, which is really bad, cause our room (409) has it´s window pointed to a very ugly part of the building and we would loose our privacy if kept it opened. So it gets really hot inside and there is nothing we could do about it. The mattress is also not that confortable, harder than usual. This was just our first day here, and I already have mixed feeling about the hotel. Wonderful in some aspects and poor about some other. After all, I have to say the Petit Palace Plaza del Carmen is a very good place to stay if you are prepared to deal with those annoying issues.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location; cool, contemporary furnishings”
Reviews.Author: Rud_Annamh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends for one evening midweek and was really impressed with the price/quality relationship. Having lived in Madrid for many years previously, I know the city very well and this is really an unbeatable location. It is literally less than one minute's walk from c\Preciados and the "Oso", which is the bear sculpture in Puerta del Sol (a popular meeting place as it's so central). In other words it's right smack bang in the centre of the city. We had a triple room - which I was a little apprehensive about as I'm not that used to sharing - but it was big and spacious. The super-high ceilings also helped give a feeling of space. There was a large TV and a laptop!(!) which we didn't use, but AFAIK was available for guests to access the web. I don't know if there was a charge, but even if there were, it's hugely convenient. The bathroom was really cool and contemporary - giant shower and really clean and new sanitaryware. The foyer is cool and spacious, and there's free water and coffee during the day. It's really sympathetically restored also, with exposed stone and huge beams next to smooth, slick finishes. I will definitely be staying there in future trips to Madrid and have already recommended it to lots of people verbally. We booked it through www.hostelworld.com.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Diamondwatcher
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during the first week of november. Its location is hard to beat as it's on a small square between Grand Via metro station and Sol. There was some construction work going on in the square but this was not a problem whilst we were there. A street nearby is a bit of a red light district, with a few street ladies and sex shops dotted about, but it was pretty tame and there is a big police station in the middle of it. There are loads of restaurants and tapas bars around the hotel area catering for most budgets. Our room was on the third floor and although it faced onto the square the double glazing was really good at keeping out traffic noise, and noise from the cinema next door. The room was fairly small with two single beds pushed together as a double. The bathroom had a good, multi head shower, but one of the walls and door is made of frosted glass which does not give a lot of privacy from the bedroom. There was a flat screen tv in the room with lots of channels in Spanish, German and French, but only Sky news in English. We also found the room would be very hot when we returned in the late afternoon, and that the air con would not cool it down quickly. Most nights we would have to leave the balcony door open to cool the room whilst we went out. The room itself was very clean, nicely decorated, with large comfy beds. The reception has two laptops with free internet access for guests. The receptionists were all fluent english speakers and mainly friendly and informative. One big problem we had was that before we booked, the hotel website stated it had a free buffet breakfast. On arrival we found the hotel was charging 9euros, and were told that there was an error on the website. We paid the 9 euros each anyway and found that it was not bad value for a small but varied buffet where you could eat as much as you like. There are plenty of places nearby where you can get breakfast for 5 - 10 euros. The metro system was cheap, easy to use and clean. The 10 trip ticket for less than 7 euros was really good value. Sol and Grand Via stations are less than 5 mins from the hotel. The hotel was good, not fantastic, and if the price was right i'd probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Familes with kids”
Reviews.Author: g0cubs
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a nice contemporary quad room with free interent access laptop in the heart of the city - really enjoyed the stay. Kids (12 and 6) loved it and we loved it - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Great, central location and free laptop access”
Reviews.Author: southernexplorer
Reviews.Content: Good location -- walking distance from the major historical sites and museums and several metro stops. Near the central shopping district. Clean, with a gigantic shower. There was construction going on in the plaza in front, so it wasn't a terribly attractive setting, but I assume that will change in the future. Service was friendly but not terribly responsive (our window wouldn't close completely and they never fixed it after being notified). My 20-something niece was thrilled because the room came with free internet access and a laptop. Some folks have complained about nearby prostitutes. We avoided the one street with a "sex shop" between the hotel and Puerto del Sol, and had no problems. Also, some restaurants nearby (Garbo, in the ground floor, and the vegetarian restaurant around the block to the west of the hotel) were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very cool decor”
Reviews.Author: jaiyen08
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in June 2007. The location is fantastic, within walking distance of all the big sights and very close to the Metro. I was with 2 kids and ended up with a "garret" room on the top floor. You enter the room in a small vestibule, then climb a circular stair to the upper floor where the beds and bathroom are. Very modernistic decor, especially the bathroom - Jacuzzi tub, huge shower with water coming from all directions, etc. The room had a severely sloping roof and one is forced to stoop when walking around the bed. You will smack your head at some point. Room also came equipped with a laptop computer and high speed Internet. The only drawback was the aircon units. One night, the whole hotel had no A/C, the next night it was just my room. Staff was responsive and fixed it, but still - 2 nights without aircon.

Reviews.Title: “Seedy area, fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: don't_fly!
Reviews.Content: Luckily, I'm not a person to make a judgement on first impressions, because this hotel is in a rather seedy enclave of Madrid. The walk from Gran Via, the nearest metro station, is along a street of sex shops and prostitutes. This is, one quickly realises, not the tone for the entire area, because within a very short walking distance are the shops around Sol and the entertainment area of Chueca. The reception staff at the hotel were really helpful and friendly and, when we complained that the noise from the cinema next door was very loud, didn't hesitate to move us to a different (and even nicer) room. I would avoid getting a room at the end of the hotel abutting the cinema (room numbers ending with a 1), because the noise really is extreme. The rooms on the top floor (fourth) are really special, though. Both rooms were superbly equipped, with good, comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, brilliant bathrooms and laptops with wi-fi internet and the decor is very tasteful and restful. The room we had on the top floor was split level; enter the room, ascend a spiral staircase and find a HUGE room with the attic beams exposed and an amazing bathroom (massive whirlpool bath, multi-directional shower, etc...) behind a frosted glass screen. One word of caution: the roof slopes down very low on one side, so if you're tall (as we both are), you can end up feeling a little like the hunchback of Notre Dame.
